name: V. Lakshmibai
content:
Venkatraman Lakshmibai is an Indian mathematician who is a professor emerita of mathematics at Northeastern University in Boston. Her research concerns algebraic geometry, the theory of algebraic groups, and representation theory,[1] including in particular the theory of flag varieties and Schubert varieties.
 Lakshmibai earned her PhD in 1976 from the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research.[1]
With Sara Billey she is the co-author of the monograph Singular Loci of Schubert Varieties (Progress in Mathematics 182, Birkhäuser, 2000).[2]
She has also co-authored two monographs with Justin Brown: Flag Varieties: An Interplay of Geometry, Combinatorics, and Representation Theory (Texts and Readings in Mathematics 53, Hindustan Book Agency, 2009)[3] and The Grassmannian Variety: Geometric and Representation-Theoretic Aspects (Developments in Mathematics 42, Springer, 2015).[4]
 In 2012 she was selected as one of the inaugural fellows of the American Mathematical Society.[5]

raw:
Indian American mathematician


In this Indian name, the name Venkatraman is a patronymic, and the person should be referred to by the given name, Lakshmibai.
Venkatraman Lakshmibai is an Indian mathematician who is a professor emerita of mathematics at Northeastern University in Boston. Her research concerns algebraic geometry, the theory of algebraic groups, and representation theory,[1] including in particular the theory of flag varieties and Schubert varieties.
Lakshmibai earned her PhD in 1976 from the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research.[1]
With Sara Billey she is the co-author of the monograph Singular Loci of Schubert Varieties (Progress in Mathematics 182, Birkhäuser, 2000).[2]
She has also co-authored two monographs with Justin Brown: Flag Varieties: An Interplay of Geometry, Combinatorics, and Representation Theory (Texts and Readings in Mathematics 53, Hindustan Book Agency, 2009)[3] and The Grassmannian Variety: Geometric and Representation-Theoretic Aspects (Developments in Mathematics 42, Springer, 2015).[4]
In 2012 she was selected as one of the inaugural fellows of the American Mathematical Society.[5]

^ a b "Venkatraman Lakshmibai", Faculty profiles, Northeastern University, retrieved 18 August 2017

^ Review of Singular Loci of Schubert Varieties by Michel Brion (2001), MR1782635

^ Review of Flag Varieties: An Interplay of Geometry, Combinatorics, and Representation Theory by Christian Ohn (2010), MR2474907

^ Review of The Grassmannian Variety: Geometric and Representation-Theoretic Aspects by Li Li, MR3408060

^ List of Fellows of the American Mathematical Society, retrieved 18 August 2017
